data.enText: a long, narrow piece of metal that you slide across the inside of a door or window in order to lock it
a piece of metal like a screw without a point which is used with a circle of metal (= a nut ) to fasten things together
nuts and bolts
a sudden flash of lightning in the sky, appearing as a line
a short heavy arrow shot from a crossbow
a long piece of cloth wound in a roll around a piece of cardboard
a bolt from the blue

data.chText: 突如其来的事件（或消息）；晴天霹雳
data.enText: an event or a piece of news which is sudden and unexpected; a complete surprise

data.chText: 她被解雇简直就是晴天霹雳。
data.enText: Her dismissal came as a bolt from the blue.
make a bolt for sth
make a bolt for it
to run away very fast, in order to escape
have shot your bolt
to have used all your power, money or supplies
to fasten sth such as a door or window by sliding a bolt across; to be able to be fastened in this way
Don't forget to bolt the door.
The gate bolts on the inside.

data.chText: 用螺栓把（甲和乙）固定在一起
data.enText: to fasten things together with a bolt

data.chText: 这虎钳是用螺栓固定在工作台上的。
data.enText: The vice is bolted to the workbench.

data.chText: 然后汽车的各种部件便用螺栓装配在一起。
data.enText: The various parts of the car are then bolted together.
if an animal, especially a horse, bolts , it suddenly runs away because it is frightened
to run away, especially in order to escape

data.chText: 他看见警察来了，便从小巷逃走了。
data.enText: When he saw the police arrive, he bolted down an alley.
to eat sth very quickly
Don't bolt your food!

data.chText: 停止支持（某团体或政党）
data.enText: to stop supporting a particular group or political party

data.chText: 很多民主党人放弃本党，转而投共和党的票。
data.enText: Many Democrats bolted the party to vote Republican.

data.chText: 过早结实（因而食用价值降低）

before.enText: of a plant, especially a vegetable

data.enText: to grow too quickly and start producing seeds and so become less good to eat

data.id-g-sent: lock, etc. the stable door after the horse has bolted

data.enText: sit/stand bolt upright

data.chText: 背部笔挺地坐 / 站；坐 / 站得笔直
data.enText: to sit or stand with your back straight

means: 用螺栓把(甲和乙)固定在一起
停止支持（某团体或政党）

ex.chText: 她正在吃面包。
ex.enText: She is eating bread.

ex.chText: 我通常吃燕麦粥当早饭。
ex.enText: I usually eat oatmeal for breakfast.

ex.chText: 中国人用筷子吃饭。
ex.enText: The Chinese eat with chopsticks.

ex.chText: 她在吃汉堡包。
ex.enText: She was eating a hamburger.

ex.chText: 我们不慌不忙地吃着。
ex.enText: We took our time and ate slowly.

ex.chText: 那些香肠应该在两天内吃掉。
ex.enText: Those sausages should be eaten within two days.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，通常指用餐、吃东西。

ex.chText: 他把早饭囫囵吞下，便上学去了。
ex.enText: He bolted down his breakfast and went to school.

ex.chText: 别那样狼吞虎咽地吃东西。
ex.enText: Don't bolt your food down like that.

synonyms.bx: 指匆匆吞咽食物，通常与 down 连用。

ex.chText: 细嚼慢咽有益于健康。
ex.enText: It is healthy to chew food well before you swallow it.

ex.chText: 幼儿长牙时爱嚼东西。
ex.enText: Babies like to chew on something when they're teething.

ex.chText: 男孩子们狼吞虎咽地吃光了汉堡和薯条。
ex.enText: The boys devoured their burgers and fries.

ex.chText: 我们坐在壁炉旁，大口大口地吃着牛肉和洋葱。
ex.enText: We sat by the fireplace, devouring beef and onions.

ex.chText: 我的狗每天至少要吃掉一罐狗粮。
ex.enText: My dog will devour at least one can of food per day.

ex.chText: 小男孩狼吞虎咽地吃下了半个苹果派。
ex.enText: The boy devoured half an apple pie.

synonyms.bx: 指饥饿时狼吞虎咽地吃东西，强调吃得快而彻底。

ex.chText: 囚犯们挖地道逃走了。
ex.enText: The prisoners have escaped by tunneling.

ex.chText: 他们从着火的房子里逃了出来。
ex.enText: They escaped from the burning house.

ex.chText: 他试图逃避惩罚。
ex.enText: He tried to escape punishment.

synonyms.bx: 用作不及物动词时，常指逃脱监禁、管制等，常后接介词 from/out of；用作及物动词时，指逃避或躲避监禁、惩罚、灾难等。

ex.chText: 小偷看见警察便急忙溜掉了。
ex.enText: The thief bolted when he saw the cops.

ex.chText: 他从开着的窗户窜了出去。
ex.enText: He bolted through the open window.

ex.chText: 人们惊慌失措地逃离火场。
ex.enText: People fled from the fire in panic.

ex.chText: 这名罪犯企图逃离该国时被抓住了。
ex.enText: The criminal was caught trying to flee the country.

synonyms.bx: 尤指因害怕有危险而逃跑，强调逃跑时动作匆忙；指逃离某个具体场所时，可作及物动词。

ex.chText: 她看见一条蛇，吓得跑掉了。
ex.enText: She saw a snake and ran away in fear.

ex.chText: 杀人犯昨晚越狱逃跑了。
ex.enText: The murderer ran away from prison last night.

synonyms.bx: 多用于口语，指突然逃离，尤指秘密地逃离某处。

data.enText: a bolt from the blue

data.chText: 突如其来的事件（或消息）；晴天霹雳
data.enText: an event or a piece of news which is sudden and unexpected; a complete surprise

data.chText: 她被解雇简直就是晴天霹雳。
data.enText: Her dismissal came as a bolt from the blue.
make a bolt for sth
make a bolt for it
to run away very fast, in order to escape
the nuts and bolts (of sth)
the basic practical details of a subject or an activity
have shot your bolt
to have used all your power, money or supplies
close, lock, etc. the stable door after the horse has bolted
close, etc. the barn door after the horse has escaped

data.chText: 马跑了才去关厩门；贼走关门，为时已晚
data.enText: to try to prevent or avoid loss or damage when it is already too late to do so
sit/stand bolt upright

data.chText: 背部笔挺地坐 / 站；坐 / 站得笔直
data.enText: to sit or stand with your back straight

tr: a sudden abandonment (as from a political party)
the act of moving with great haste
example: he made a dash for the door

tr: a screw that screws into a nut to form a fastener
the part of a lock that is engaged or withdrawn with a key
a sliding bar in a breech-loading firearm that ejects an empty cartridge and replaces it and closes the breech
a roll of cloth or wallpaper of a definite length
a discharge of lightning accompanied by thunder
secure or lock with a bolt
leave suddenly and as if in a hurry
example: The listeners bolted when he discussed his strange ideas
When she started to tell silly stories, I ran out

tr: usually includes taking something or somebody along
example: The thief made off with our silver
the accountant absconded with the cash from the safe
he ran bang into the pole

value.def: A bolt is a long metal object which screws into a nut and is used to fasten things together.
When you bolt one thing to another, you fasten them firmly together, using a bolt.

example.ex: The safety belt is easy to fit as there's no need to bolt it to seat belt anchorage points...
example.tran: 由于不必扣在座位的固定夹上，安全带很容易就可以系好。

example.ex: ...a wooden bench which was bolted to the floor.
example.tran: 用螺栓固定在地板上的木制长椅

value.def: A bolt on a door or window is a metal bar that you can slide across in order to fasten the door or window.

example.ex: I heard the sound of a bolt being slowly and reluctantly slid open.
example.tran: 我听到门闩被缓慢而吃力地拉开的声音。

value.def: When you bolt a door or window, you slide the bolt across to fasten it.

example.ex: He reminded her that he would have to lock and bolt the kitchen door after her.
example.tran: 他提醒她,在她走后他得把厨房的门上锁并闩上。

value.def: If a person or animal bolts, they suddenly start to run very fast, often because something has frightened them.

example.ex: The pig rose squealing and bolted...
example.tran: 那头猪突然嗷嗷叫着狂奔起来。

example.ex: I made some excuse and bolted for the exit.
example.tran: 我编了个借口后便向出口冲去。

value.tran: （常指人或动物因受惊吓）迅速逃跑，逃窜

value.def: If you bolt your food, you eat it so quickly that you hardly chew it or taste it.

example.ex: Being under stress can cause you to miss meals, eat on the move, or bolt your food.
example.tran: 人在压力之下有时会吃不上饭，或边走边吃，或是匆匆吃上几口。

example.ex: Back then I could bolt down three or four burgers and a pile of French fries.
example.tran: 那时我一顿能吃下三四个汉堡和一大堆炸薯条。

value.def: A bolt of lightning is a flash of lightning that is seen as a white line in the sky.

example.ex: Suddenly a bolt of lightning crackled through the sky.
example.tran: 突然一道闪电划破长空。

value.def: A bolt of cloth is a long wide piece of it that is wound into a roll round a piece of cardboard.
When vegetables such as lettuces or onions bolt, they grow too quickly and produce flowers and seeds, and therefore become less good to eat.

example.ex: If the soil dries out the plants may bolt.
example.tran: 如果土壤过干，植株可能会过早结实。

value.tran: （蔬菜）生长过快，结实过早（而不宜食用）

value.def: If someone makes a bolt for somewhere, or makes a bolt for it, they make a sudden escape.

example.ex: His father kept a tight grip on his collar in case he should make a bolt for the door.
example.tran: 他的父亲紧紧抓住他的衣领，防止他夺门而逃。

value.def: If a piece of news comes like a bolt from the blue, it is completely unexpected and very surprising.

example.ex: The company decided to appoint a Japanese manager as president of the company. The decision came as a bolt from the blue.
example.tran: 公司决定任命一位日籍经理担任总裁。这个决定太出乎意料了。

value.tran: 晴天霹雳；出人意表；令人大吃一惊

value.def: If someone is sitting or standing bolt upright, they are sitting or standing very straight.

example.ex: When I pushed his door open, Trevor was sitting bolt upright in bed.
example.tran: 当我推开特雷弗的房门时，他正腰杆笔直地坐在床上。

xrse.def: to close the stable door after the horse has bolted
